titles.title: Gunn McKay Nature Preserve Act
Gunn McKay Nature Preserve Act
To designate certain Federal lands in the State of Utah as the Gunn McKay Nature Preserve, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 107-392.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 230.

action.text: Mr. Hansen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3909.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Bingaman without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 682.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 4/9/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Gunn McKay Nature Preserve Act - Designates specified National Forest System land in Utah as the Gunn McKay Nature Preserve.Requires the Secretary of Agriculture to develop a Preserve management plan and authorizes the Secretary to enter into a cooperative management agreement with the Gunn McKay Nature Preserve Foundation, Inc.Withdraws the Preserve from all forms of location, entry, and patent under public land laws and mining and mineral leasing laws.
